page.title: 07Lead Pollution in Scunthorpe
page.content: My dad works in the{Enviromental {Health Department.}In June 1982 six Scunthorpe schools were tested for {lead pollution.}One of the six had a high lead level in the dust in the playground and that was{Ashby Junior {School,}the school which I go to. The lead level was{6600 parts per {million}compared with Manchester at 970 ppm, Birmingham at 1200 ppm and London at up to 1840 ppm. Further dust samples were taken at my school, which confirmed the problem. The lead had come from{old {paint}which had flaked off and had mixed with the dust. By hosing down the playground, further readings were found to be no higher than 1200 ppm.
